attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2015-0059

Date: 2015-01-29

Whereas the Honourable John A. McMunagle, Judge of the Superior Court of Justice in and for the Province of Ontario, has become afflicted with a permanent infirmity disabling him from the due execution of his office and has tendered his resignation;

 

Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice,

 

(a) accepts the resignation of the Honourable John A. McMunagle; and

 

(b) pursuant to paragraph 42(1)(c) of the Judges Act, grants to the Honourable John A. McMunagle an annuity of $200,533.33, commencing as of the date of the making of this Order and continuing during his life.


Attendu que l’honorable John A. McMunagle, juge de la Cour supérieure de Justice de l’Ontario, a donné sa démission pour incapacité par suite d’une infirmité permanente,

 

À ces causes, sur recommandation du ministre de la Justice, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil :

 

a) accepte la démission de l’honorable John A. McMunagle;

 

b) en vertu de l’alinéa 42(1)c) de la Loi sur les juges, accorde à l’honorable John A. McMunagle, à titre viager, une pension annuelle de 200 533,33 $ payable à compter de la date de prise du présent décret.
attachmentText:
PC Number: 2015-0059Date: 2015-01-29


Whereas the Honourable John A. McMunagle, Judge of the Superior Court of Justice in and for the Province of Ontario, has become afflicted with a permanent infirmity disabling him from the due execution of his office and has tendered his resignation;


 


Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice,


 


(a) accepts the resignation of the Honourable John A. McMunagle; and


 


(b) pursuant to paragraph 42(1)(c) of the Judges Act, grants to the Honourable John A. McMunagle an annuity of $200,533.33, commencing as of the date of the making of this Order and continuing during his life.



Attendu que l’honorable John A. McMunagle, juge de la Cour supérieure de Justice de l’Ontario, a donné sa démission pour incapacité par suite d’une infirmité permanente,


 


À ces causes, sur recommandation du ministre de la Justice, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil :


 


a) accepte la démission de l’honorable John A. McMunagle; 


 


b) en vertu de l’alinéa 42(1)c) de la Loi sur les juges, accorde à l’honorable John A. McMunagle, à titre viager, une pension annuelle de 200 533,33 $ payable à compter de la date de prise du présent décret.
